New Records: Gerrit Cole pitched like a postseason ace, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run over seven innings
Key Match Events: New York Yankees' bullpen dominated a tense AL Division Series, extending the scoreless streak by Yankees relievers to 15 2/3 innings this postseason
Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres, and Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees
A near-fracas nearly ignited Kansas City, though, Witt, who had been 1 for 15 in the series, followed with a base hit and Vinnie Pasquantino — who'd been 0 for 14 — had an RBI double
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win

Matt Quatraro, Royals manager, said, 'Feel really badly for those guys in the room, because as you know, this is seven, eight months of the year that they just pour it all into it, and give every ounce of effort and energy they have.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York Yankees set the tone from the start, pouncing on Wacha like it did in the series opener
Cole's night ended after he got Isbel to fly out to the warning track with a runner aboard to end the seventh
Others: The Kansas City Royals went from 106-loss laughingstock a year ago to making its first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series
